intro: Chaetogastra kingii, commonly known as the King's chaetogastra, is a rare flowering plant native to the Cape Province of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
